Error \(R^2\) Adjusted \(R^2\) 1068 0.1154 0.3833 0.3828 For every one unit increase of the proportion of posts that oppose rival political parties/beliefs, the proportion of posts that are about their state or district decrease by .

item.title: Ethics of Data Science
item.description: After perusing through the data is beautiful thread the first thing that caught my eye were all the stunning graphs that people created. For example i came across a visual of united states that showed where each state placed based on per capita per sales of different alcoholic beverages. I was shocked to see that new Hampshire was the top five if nor first place for all of them. I would assume though they raked the states by proportions not by just sheer amount.

item.title: The begining of a Data Sceince Project
item.description: The begining of every data prowl begins with some pretty graphs. In order to understand the data, to its fullest, univariate and bivariate graphs are a great way to go about that. A univariate graph or a graph expressing only a single variable tells the story of the single graph. Answering several important quetions. Is it normally distrubited? Do the numbers/levels make sense? What do i need to fix/change and so on.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
